    • getOrDefault

      public static boolean getOrDefault(boolean otherB, Visitor v)
      I honest to god don't know what this does. It returns the visitors scope's parent's parent's parent's scope's value for `sore`. I forgot what the sore field does.
      Parameters:
      otherB - The other boolean
      v - The visitor to get the sore field from
      Returns:
      Return whether or not the visitor is sore.

      Returns:
      The returned WebServer object.

    • register

      public static void register(String text, boolean formatted)
      Register a new library to Q. This means the library has been imported, and Q won't throw an error when trying to use it's methods or classes.
      Parameters:
      text - The name of the library
      formatted - Whether or not the library has had '.q.' removed from the beginning of the name

      Get a random String. Not my code, this is from stack overflow
      Returns:
      The randomized string.

    • resolveImport

      public static void resolveImport(String lib)
      Try and resolve a local import by checking the current directories for the library file.
      Parameters:
      lib - The import in question.

    • getWinByName

      public static QWinKit getWinByName(String name)
      This method attempts to get an AWT window object by it's name from Q's Environment file.
      Parameters:
      name - The window variable's name, what to look for.
      Returns:
      Returns the QWinKit java object to perform operations on the window.

    • check

      public static void check(String lib, String libNoChanges, org.antlr.v4.runtime.ParserRuleContext ctx, boolean namespaceImport, String className, String namespace)
      This method checks if a library has been imported. If it has, then it will continue, if not, it'll try and look for it, and throw an error.
      Parameters:
      lib - The library to check import status on.
      libNoChanges - The library name a second time, this one isn't changed by anything, and is only used to print.
      ctx - The current ParserRuleContext, used to throw the error accurately.
      namespaceImport - The namespace import of the project, to see if the namespace the library is in is automatically imported (namespaces are non functional.).
      className - The name of the class where the error occured.
      namespace - The namespace of the current file.

    • check

      public static void check(String lib, String libUnchanged, org.antlr.v4.runtime.ParserRuleContext ctx, String className, String namespace)
      Very similar to just with different parameters
      Parameters:
      lib - The library to check import status on.
      libUnchanged - The library name a second time, this one isn't changed by anything, and is only used to print.
      ctx - The current ParserRuleContext, used to throw the error accurately.
      className - The name of the class where the error occured.
      namespace - The namespace of the current file.

    • replaceLast

      public static String replaceLast(String text, String regex, String replacement)
      General use method to replace the last instance of a regex expression in a string with something else.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to check contents of.
      regex - The regex to look for.
      replacement - The replacement text.
      Returns:
      The final product after replacement.

    • execCmd

      public static String execCmd(String cmd)
      This method executes a terminal command. I have several of these methods. Like many others, this method is not functional.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The command to execute
      Returns:
      The return value of the executed command.

    • copyDirectory

      public static void copyDirectory(String sourceDirectoryLocation, String destinationDirectoryLocation) throws IOException
      Copy a directory to another location. I do not believe this is my code.
      Parameters:
      sourceDirectoryLocation - The source directory is the directory to copy.
      destinationDirectoryLocation - The desired destination to copy the first directory to.
      Throws:
      IOException - Throws an IOException in case the file operation goes badly.
